name: Quahuacan Cliff
desc: Living with the Qucusaurs, this is the home of the tribe known as the Flower-Feather Clan. Every day, members of the tribe fly with the Qucusaurs, patrolling their territory from the air.

imgDesc.text: Living with the Qucusaurs, this is the home of the tribe known as the Flower-Feather Clan. Every day, members of the tribe fly with the Qucusaurs, patrolling their territory from the air.

In order to deal with the crisis brought on by the ash that once enveloped the foothills like fog, the priests of the Masters of the Night-Wind once studied the secret art of how to make graffiti that would be visible even through the mists. It is said that this was the origin of the unique power of the graffiti here.
Walls with graffiti that chronicles the stories of the heroes of the past. But are the stories recorded here true stories that once happened, or the shadows of another story...

customize.name: Recipe: Glittering Gemstones
customize.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Glittering Gemstones.

customize.name: Recipe: Chocolate
customize.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Chocolate.

customize.name: Recipe: Stuffed N' Mashed Potatoes
customize.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Stuffed N' Mashed Potatoes.

customize.name: Ensnaring Gaze
customize.desc:
An object obtained after defeating the monster known as the Tenebrous Papilla. It may look like a piece of fruit, but it is not.
Formed from energy that has condensed in a single spot, its "eye" seems to gaze out from a distant, dark otherworld.

customize.name: Crimson Obsidian Fragment
customize.desc: An obsidian fragment with engraved patterns styled like those of the Flower-Feather Clan, which you obtained by chance while exploring. It appears that you could form a full ring using three of them, though what that will achieve, you cannot tell.

customize.name: Crimson Obsidian Ring
customize.desc: An obsidian ring with engraved patterns styled like those of the Flower-Feather Clan. It is an ancient medium by which the tribe established contact with the deep night. Perhaps its strength can allow you to cross the boundary between this place and a certain other location...

customize.name: Radiant Spincrystal 141
customize.desc: This wondrous crystal contains a certain rhythm, like something beautiful woven from delicate silk. These items can be found throughout the mainland or from merchants who collect curios. The tune held within this crystal can be revivified in your Serenitea Pot using either "Euphonium Unbound: Winding" or "Euphonium Unbound: Soaring." The tune contained within this Radiant Spincrystal is a mysterious melody from Natlan.

customize.name: Radiant Spincrystal 142
customize.desc: This wondrous crystal contains a certain rhythm, like something beautiful woven from delicate silk. These items can be found throughout the mainland or from merchants who collect curios. The tune held within this crystal can be revivified in your Serenitea Pot using either "Euphonium Unbound: Winding" or "Euphonium Unbound: Soaring." The tune contained within this Radiant Spincrystal is a mysterious melody from Natlan.

customize.name: Tenebrous Papilla: Type I
customize.desc:
Abyssal creatures with plant-like forms that have descended from a deep, dark, unfathomable, contorted otherworld.
These twisted monstrosities are capable of infiltrating deep down into the bowels of the earth, extracting memories to imitate and manipulate. Through this process of distorting the past's memories into more abstruse and sordid forms, they gradually draw closer to Irminsul's core, threatening to undermine its very existence.
Some say that these aberrations work constantly to corrupt the many colors of light, leaving only pitch-black information in their stead. Such a hypothesis seems to be confirmed by the branches they extend outward, as if to pierce the void itself...

customize.name: Qucusaurus
customize.desc:
A Saurian with large, supple wings that can glide through the air for long periods.
It is said that the ancestors of the Qucusaurs were the closest in form to the mighty winged dragons, and that they could soar through the sky like clouds. According to the storytellers, when the greatest of such dragons spread its wings, the entire sky would be blotted out. Of course, the Qucusaurs we see today no longer possess such forms, but the claws they hide within their downy feather coats remain as sharp as ever.

customize.name: Qucusaurus Chick
customize.desc:
A young Qucusaur with a light, agile body.
Its neck and wings have yet to fully develop, and it still has a long way to go before it can wield gaseous phlogiston. There are stories of older Qucusaurs pushing younglings off cliffs to encourage them to fly. While the truth of such tales is uncertain, as long as it keeps practicing day and night, there can be no doubt that the soft-feathered fledgling will eventually grow strong and resilient.

customize.name: Winged Warrior: Skysoarer
customize.desc:
A warrior from the clifftops, and a tribal guardian that patrols the steep mountain ridges.
These tribal warriors trust their own two hands more than any weapon. Above all else, they are renowned for their lithe and agile bearing.

customize.name: Winged Warrior: Feathershedder
customize.desc:
A warrior from the clifftops, and a tribal guardian that patrols the steep mountain ridges.
Proud sword wielders whose blade strokes are as sweeping as a Qucusaur's outstretched wingspan. Blood sprays forth like scattered feathers from the wounds they inflict.

customize.name: Winged Warrior: Skymaster
customize.desc:
A warrior from the clifftops, and a tribal guardian that patrols the steep mountain ridges.
By observing and emulating the claw strikes of airborne Saurians, these warriors have grasped the essence of harnessing their own power. Their kicks, delivered from up high, should not be underestimated.

customize.name: Qucusaurus Warrior: Blazing Sky
customize.desc:
A powerful warrior from the clifftops, whose bravery has been acknowledged and for which they may wear the Saurian Crown.
Among the many varieties of Saurians, the Qucusaurs stand particularly proud, and this is a trait that is shared by the Qucusaurus Warriors who are able to obtain their recognition. It is said that in the past, tribal warriors would watch these crimson Saurians amuse themselves by tossing flaming stones from great heights; and that it was this that first inspired them to set off projectiles to cause explosive chain reactions. This concept, gradually refined over time, is said to have been the origin of many of the Flower-Feather Clan's firearms.

customize.name: Qucusaurus Warrior: Heartstar Hammer
customize.desc:
A powerful warrior from the clifftops, whose bravery has been acknowledged and for which they may wear the Saurian Crown.
Even in Natlan, the Nation of Pyro, members of the Flower-Feather Clan have a unique approach when it comes to wielding fire and flames. For these tribal warriors, armed as they are with heavy hammers, flames are something that burst forth from violent collisions, symbols of intense passion. When they do battle, the fight usually ends within an instant— and they are always the ones who stand victorious.

customize.name: Burning-Aflame Wayob Manifestation
customize.desc:
The Flower-Feather Clan believe in and worship the Wayob, which manifests upon the land with the power of totems and Nightsouls.
They say that long ago, Wayob Manifestations looked very different from how they do today, taking on a rougher form that was more akin to that of an obsidian statue. But once their outline had been recorded in woven scrolls, there have been few changes in their appearance since.
The people of the Flower-Feather Clan believe their Wayob has the power to control fire and burning flames, and can also control the flow of heat and blazing winds.

customize.name: Cacaua Goat
customize.desc:
These gentle beasts can be found all over Teyvat and were among the earliest to be domesticated by humans.
Contrary to what the name might suggest, Cacaua Goats do not give off a uniquely bitter odor. This unforgettable name originates from the hue of their wool, which closely resembles that of food and drink made from Cacahuatl. For traditional Natlan dyers, achieving a chocolate or xocoatl color is not an easy task, as the slightest mistake might result in a dirty-looking finish like rain-soaked mud. The wool of these robustly-built Cacaua Goats has a smooth texture and a clean, chocolatey tone, which is why they are so highly valued...

customize.name: Mutota
customize.desc: Chief of the Flower-Feather Clan.

customize.name: Allpa
customize.desc: Elder of the Flower-Feather Clan.

customize.name: Solid Phlogiston in the Flying Area
